abstract.p: Five fiction writers, three poets, one nonfiction writer and one playwright are this year's recipients of $35,000 awards given to emerging writers by Mrs Giles Whiting Foundation (S)

block.p: Ten writers deemed to show exceptional talent and promise have been named winners of this year's Whiting Writers' Awards, carrying a prize of $35,000 each. Among the recipients named by the Mrs. Giles Whiting Foundation, acting on nominations by a selection committee of writers, literary scholars and editors, were five fiction writers, three poets, one nonfiction writer and one playwright.

Ten writers deemed to show exceptional talent and promise have been named winners of this year's Whiting Writers' Awards, carrying a prize of $35,000 each. Among the recipients named by the Mrs. Giles Whiting Foundation, acting on nominations by a selection committee of writers, literary scholars and editors, were five fiction writers, three poets, one nonfiction writer and one playwright.
Robert Cohen, fiction writer, ''The Organ Builder'' (Harper & Row).
Samantha Gillison, fiction writer, ''The Undiscovered Country'' (Grove Press).
Lily King, fiction writer, ''The Pleasing Hour'' (Atlantic Monthly Press).
John McManus, fiction writer, ''Stop Breakin' Down'' (Picador).
Andrew X. Pham, nonfiction writer, ''Catfish and Mandala: A Two-Wheeled Voyage Through the Landscape and Memory of Vietnam'' (Farrar, Straus & Giroux).
James Thomas Stevens/Aronhiotas, poet, ''Tokinish'' (First Intensity Press).
Kelly Stuart, playwright, ''A Shoe Is Not a Question,'' ''The Life of Spiders,'' ''The Square Root of Terrible,'' ''Demonology.''
Claude Wilkinson, poet, ''Reading the Earth'' (Michigan State University Press).
